item.title: 亚洲股市在全球抛售后试图企稳；关注美国数据
item.description: 周四，亚洲股市在遭遇大幅抛售后试图重新站稳脚跟，而国债反弹则抑制了美元汇率，并推高了日元，因为美国经济忧虑提高了美联储大幅降息的可能性。【原文：Asian share markets tried to regain their footing on Thursday after a steep sell-off, while a rally in Treasuries dented the dollar and lifted the yen as U.S. economic worries raised the odds of the Federal Reserve going big on rate cuts.】

item.title: 前官员称美国经济放缓但仍有动力
item.description: 美国前财政部长罗伯特-鲁宾（Robert Rubin）周四表示，美国经济正在放缓，但仍有一定的发展势头。【原文：The U.S. economy is slowing but it still has some momentum, former Treasury Secretary Robert Rubin said on Thursday.】

item.title: 聚焦：比亚迪全球扩张遭遇日本严峻考验
item.description: 比亚迪正在日本推出电动汽车充电站，并加强市场营销和客户激励措施，旨在提高日本市场的销量，而日本市场已成为这家中国汽车制造商全球扩张的绊脚石。【原文：BYD is rolling out electric-vehicle charging stations and ramping up marketing and customer incentives in Japan, aiming to boost sales in a market that has become a stumbling block in the Chinese automaker's global expansion.】

item.title: 美联储戴利称需要降息以保持劳动力市场健康
item.description: 旧金山联储主席玛丽-戴利（Mary Daly）周三表示，美联储需要降息来保持劳动力市场的健康，但现在要看即将公布的经济数据来决定降息的幅度。【原文：The Federal Reserve needs to cut interest rates to keep the labor market healthy, but it is now down to incoming economic data to determine by how much, San Francisco Fed President Mary Daly said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 对美联储降息幅度过大的押注不断升温，美元摇摆不定
item.description: 由于交易商加大了对美联储本月晚些时候超大规模降息的押注，美元周四下跌，日元因避险需求而表现突出，因为对美国经济增长前景的担忧再次浮现。【原文：The dollar dipped on Thursday as traders ramped up bets for a supersized rate cut from the Federal Reserve later this month, with the yen a notable outperformer on safe-haven demand as concerns over the U.S. economy's growth outlook resurfaced.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，Stellantis 将暂停生产吉普在美国最畅销的两款车型
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三报道，吉普车的母公司斯泰兰特公司（Stellantis）将暂停生产其在美国最畅销的两款车型。【原文：Jeep's parent company Stellantis is pressing pause on making two of its top-selling U.S. models, The Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 投资者权衡需求疲软、欧佩克+可能推迟增产等因素，石油价格持稳
item.description: 在经历了隔夜的抛售之后，石油公司在周四早盘试图守住阵线，因为各方都在努力应对需求疲软以及下个月更多供应可能推迟进入市场的问题。【原文：Oil was attempting to hold its line in early trade on Thursday after an overnight sell-off, as players grappled with weak demand alongside a possible delay to more supply entering the market next month.】

item.title: 市场过度预期美联储降息，美元弱势停滞不前
item.description: 据路透社调查，大多数外汇策略师认为，尽管金融市场交易商加大了对美联储降息的押注，但美元近期的疲软态势将在未来三个月停滞不前。【原文：Recent U.S. dollar weakness will stall in the coming three months despite financial market traders ramping up bets for Federal Reserve interest rate cuts, according to a majority of foreign exchange strategists surveyed by Reuters.】

item.title: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构批准 TPG Telecom-Optus 交易
item.description: 澳大利亚竞争监管机构周四表示，不会反对 TPG 电信公司与新加坡电信公司旗下 Optus 公司之间的网络共享交易。【原文：Australia's competition watchdog will not oppose the network sharing deal between TPG Telecom and Singapore Telecommunications' Optus, the regulator said on Thursday.】

item.title: 新日铁称美国外国投资委员会未就美国钢铁交易提供最新信息
item.description: 日本新日铁公司（Nippon Steel Corp）周四表示，尚未收到美国外国投资委员会（CFIUS）关于该公司拟以 149 亿美元收购美国钢铁公司（U. S. Steel）的任何最新消息。【原文：Nippon Steel Corp has not received any update from the Committee on Foreign Investment in the United States (CFIUS) regarding the company's proposed $14.9 billion acquisition of U.S. Steel , the Japanese company said on Thursday.】

item.title: 日本 7 月份经通胀调整后的工资连续两个月上涨
item.description: 日本政府周四公布的数据显示，由于夏季奖金增加，日本 7 月份经通胀调整后的工资连续两个月增长。【原文：Japan's inflation-adjusted wages rose for two consecutive months in July thanks to a bump in summertime bonuses, government data showed on Thursday.】

item.title: 通用汽车将在巴西推出首批乙醇混合动力汽车
item.description: 通用汽车公司（General Motors）周三表示，该公司将开始在巴西生产有史以来第一批混合动力柔性车，这种车可以使用 100% 的乙醇或汽油以及电池。【原文：General Motors said on Wednesday that it would begin producing its first-ever hybrid-flex vehicles that can run on 100% ethanol or gasoline alongside their batteries in Brazil.】

item.title: Robinhood 就加密货币提现问题与加州达成 390 万美元和解协议
item.description: 加利福尼亚州总检察长罗布-邦塔周三表示，Robinhood Markets 运营的一个加密货币平台将支付 390 万美元，原因是该平台在 2018 年至 2022 年期间未能让客户从其账户中提取加密货币。【原文：A cryptocurrency platform run by Robinhood Markets will pay $3.9 million for failing to let customers withdraw cryptocurrency from their accounts from 2018 to 2022, California Attorney General Rob Bonta said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 早间竞价美联储将降息 50 个基点，目前市场恐慌情绪各占一半
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 惠普企业上调年度利润预期，原因是人工智能表现强劲
item.description: 惠普企业公司周三上调了年度利润预期，原因是企业对人工智能基础设施的投资增加，导致对人工智能服务器的需求持续回升。【原文：Hewlett Packard Enterprise raised its annual profit forecast on Wednesday, as demand for artificial intelligence servers continues to pick up owing to higher investments in AI infrastructure by businesses.】

item.title: 克罗格首席执行官在庭审中将涨价归咎于成本上升
item.description: 克罗格公司（Kroger）首席执行官罗德尼-麦克马伦（Rodney McMullen）在周三的庭审中为该杂货连锁公司拟与竞争对手阿尔伯森公司（Albertsons）价值 250 亿美元的合并案辩护时，将杂货价格上涨归因于零售商成本增加。【原文：Kroger CEO Rodney McMullen attributed rising grocery prices to increasing costs for retailers as he defended the grocery chain's proposed $25 billion merger with rival Albertsons at a trial on Wednesday.】

item.title: 破产的 Steward Health 获准亏本出售马萨诸塞州六家医院
item.description: 美国最大的私营医院运营商 Steward Health Care 周三获得了破产法官的批准，可以出售马萨诸塞州的六家医院，尽管这笔价值 3.43 亿美元的出售没有带来任何利润。【原文：Steward Health Care, the largest private hospital operator in the U.S., received a bankruptcy judge's approval on Wednesday to sell six Massachusetts hospitals, despite taking no profit from the $343 million sale.】

item.title: 空中客车公司和罗尔斯公司将向航空公司介绍情况，以缓解 A350 的检查压力
item.description: 两位熟悉内情的人士说，航空公司可能会被告知没有必要立即对空客A350-1000进行全球检查，从而结束了国泰航空因发动机突发事件而对其机队进行审查后数日的不确定性。【原文：Airlines will likely be told there is no immediate need for global checks on the Airbus A350-1000, ending days of uncertainty after an engine emergency prompted Cathay Pacific to review its fleet, two people familiar with the matter said.】

item.title: ASML 首席执行官称美国限制对华设备出口是出于 "经济动机
item.description: 荷兰计算机芯片设备供应商ASML公司首席执行官周三表示，由美国主导的以国家安全为名限制该公司向中国客户出口的运动随着时间的推移已变得更具 "经济动机"。【原文：The chief executive of Dutch computer chip equipment supplier ASML on Wednesday said a U.S.-led campaign to restrict the company's exports to customers in China in the name of national security has become more "economically motivated" over time.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，强生公司在滑石粉和解问题上战胜了长期以来的顽固派
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引熟悉内情的人士的话报道，强生公司在提高了对索赔人的报价后，有望获得更多支持其滑石粉和解计划的选票，这动摇了一个长期的法律对手。【原文：Johnson & Johnson is expected to secure more votes in favor of its talc settlement plan after increasing its offer to claimants, which has swayed a longtime legal adversary, WSJ reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 英伟达发言人称未收到美国司法部传票
item.description: 英伟达发言人在周三的一份声明中说，英伟达没有收到美国司法部的传票。【原文：Nvidia did not receive a U.S. Justice Department subpoena, a spokesperson said in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 首席财务官称，英特尔制造业务将在 2027 年实现 "有意义的 "收入
item.description: 英特尔公司首席财务官周三在投资者会议上表示，英特尔将于 2027 年开始从其合约芯片制造业务中获得 "可观 "的收入。【原文：Intel will begin to generate a "meaningful" amount of revenue from its contract chip manufacturing business in 2027, the company's CFO said at an investor conference on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储调查显示，最近几周美国企业经济活动放缓
item.description: 从 7 月中旬到 8 月下旬，美国经济活动的扩张速度放缓，企业报告的招聘人数减少，这些信号都强调了美联储将在本月晚些时候降低利率的原因。【原文：U.S. economic activity expanded more slowly from mid July through late August and businesses reported less hiring, signals that underscore why the Federal Reserve is set to lower interest rates later this month.】

item.title: 主要图书出版商驳回互联网档案馆关于数字扫描的上诉
item.description: 美国一家上诉法院支持四家主要图书出版商的诉讼请求，他们指控非营利性机构互联网档案馆非法扫描版权作品，并未经许可在网上免费向公众出借这些作品。【原文：A U.S. appeals court sided with four major book publishers that accused the nonprofit Internet Archive of illegally scanning copyrighted works and lending them to the public online for free and without permission.】

item.title: 花旗银行调查显示，美国加快结汇的冲击比预期更大
item.description: 花旗集团（Citigroup）的一项调查显示，今年早些时候美国证券交易转向短期结算，对市场参与者的影响超出预期，其中欧洲受到的冲击最大。【原文：A shift to shorter settlement for U.S. securities transactions earlier this year had a greater-than-anticipated impact on market participants across the board, with Europe reporting the greatest hit, a Citigroup survey showed.】

item.title: 消息人士称拜登准备阻止新日铁收购美国钢铁公司
item.description: 一位消息人士周三称，美国总统乔-拜登正准备阻止新日铁收购美国钢铁公司。【原文：U.S. President Joe Biden is preparing to block Nippon Steel's acquisition of U.S. Steel, a source said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，哈里斯将削减拜登的资本利得税提案
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周三援引知情人士的话报道，民主党总统提名人卡马拉-哈里斯（Kamala Harris）正计划提议降低资本利得税的最高税率。【原文：Democratic presidential nominee Kamala Harris is planning to propose a less drastic increase in the top capital gains tax rate, the Wall Street Journal reported on Wednesday, citing people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 欧盟监管机构就谷歌避免被指控的合规建议征求反馈意见
item.description: 直接知情人士周三表示，欧盟反垄断监管机构将于下周就谷歌为遵守旨在促进公平竞争的技术规则而提出的建议征求反馈意见，这可能会决定谷歌是否面临正式指控。【原文：European Union antitrust regulators will seek feedback next week on Google's proposals to comply with tech rules aimed at promoting fair competition, people with direct knowledge of the matter said on Wednesday, which could decide whether it faces formal charges.】

item.title: 戴姆勒卡车任命董事会成员卡琳-拉德斯特罗姆（Karin Radstrom）为新任首席执行官
item.description: 德国戴姆勒卡车控股公司（Daimler Truck Holding AG）周三表示，已任命卡琳-拉德斯特罗姆（Karin Radstrom）为公司新任首席执行官，自 10 月 1 日起生效。【原文：Germany's Daimler Truck Holding AG said on Wednesday it had appointed Karin Radstrom as its new CEO, effective Oct. 1.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克的 X 公司上诉获胜，阻止了加州内容节制法的部分规定
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）的社交媒体平台 X 周三赢得上诉，部分阻止了加州要求社交媒体公司公布打击虚假信息、骚扰、仇恨言论和极端主义政策的法律。【原文：Elon Musk’s social media platform X on Wednesday won an appeal to partially block a California law requiring social media companies to publish their policies for combating disinformation, harassment, hate speech and extremism.】
